actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking.
Committee on Banking. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Banking. Reported to Senate by Senator Garn with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 841.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the United States Mint for fiscal year 1986 and 1987.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Authorizes appropriations for the Bureau of the Mint for FY 1987 for costs of the mint and assay office and for expansion and improvement of mint facilities. Redesignates the U.S. assay office in San Francisco as a U.S. mint. Prescribes penalties to be imposed on anyone who, except under the authority of the Secretary of the Treasury, controls or possesses a device similar to any distinctive counterfeit deterrent device adopted by the United States for its securities or other obligations. Includes any electronic means of counterfeiting as counterfeiting apparatus for purposes of counterfeiting prohibitions. Authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury, after apprising the Secretary of State, to engrave and print currency and other security documents or engage in related research and development for a foreign country on a reimbursable basis, provided that such activity does not interfere with the Bureau of Engraving and Printing's domestic production. Provides that the Secretary of the Treasury shall not be required to reissue U.S. currency notes upon redemption. Establishes the Treasurer of the United States as an Executive Schedule level IV position.

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the United States Mint for fiscal year 1986 and 1987.
